# Keysight Technologies (KEYS) - Comprehensive Analysis Report

## 1. Company Overview

Keysight Technologies, Inc. provides electronic design and test solutions worldwide. The company operates through Communications Solutions Group and Electronic Industrial Solutions Group segments. Keysight Technologies, Inc. is an American company that manufactures electronics test and measurement equipment and software. The company was formed as a spin-off of Agilent Technologies, which inherited and rebranded the test and measurement product lines developed and produced, from the late 1960s to the turn of the millennium, by Hewlett-Packard's Test and Measurement division. Keysight Technologies, Inc. was founded in 1939 and is headquartered in Santa Rosa, California.

The company serves as the world's leading test and measurement provider and enables innovators to push the boundaries of engineering by quickly solving design, emulation, and test challenges to help create the best product experiences. We conduct business annually with over 40,000 customers around the world, including most Fortune 1000 companies who are developing new electronic technologies, networks, systems, devices and components. Keysight owns 2,000+ patents and our ~15,000 employees work with nearly 32,000 customers worldwide to start technology revolutions.

## 2. Current Market Data

**Stock Price & Market Cap:**
• As of Jan 03, 2026, Keysight Technologies (KEYS) is trading at a price of 206.64, with a previous close of 203.19.
• The stock has fluctuated within a day range of 203.72 to 207.05, while its 52-week range spans from 121.43 to 214.58.
• Today Keysight Technologies Inc. has the market capitalization of ‪36.85 B‬, it has decreased by −1.03% over the last week.

**Analyst Coverage:**
• The average 12-month price target for Keysight Technologies is USD219.76923, with a high estimate of USD240 and a low estimate of USD190. 9 analysts recommend buying the stock, while 0 suggest selling, leading to an overall rating of Buy.

## 3. Existing Products/Services

**Core Product Portfolio:**
Instruments include oscilloscopes, multimeters, logic analyzers, signal generators, spectrum analyzers, vector network analyzers, atomic force microscopes (AFM), automated optical inspection, automated X-ray inspection (5DX), in-circuit testers, power supplies, tunable lasers, optical power meters, wavelength-meters, electro-optic converters, optical modulation analyzers and handheld tools.

**Comprehensive Solutions:**
Additionally, it provides oscilloscopes; generators, sources and power supplies; software products; analyzers; wireless products; network test and security; modular instruments; meters; network visibility; and other products, as well as KeysightCare support plans, calibration, repair, technology refresh, test as a service, network/security, consulting, financial alternatives, education, software testing, support, managed, device vulnerability analysis, support portal, and used equipment services.

**Market Leadership:**
This differentiation enables Keysight to be recognized as a leader in six core measurement platforms: RF and Microwave Design Simulation software, Network Test, Network Analyzers, Oscilloscopes, Signal Analyzers and Signal Sources.

## 4. Planned Products/Services/Projects

**Quantum Computing Initiatives:**
• Keysight announced the release of Quantum System Analysis, a breakthrough Electronic Design Automation (EDA) solution that enables quantum engineers to simulate and optimize quantum systems at the system level. This new capability marks a significant expansion of Keysight's Quantum EDA portfolio, which includes Quantum Layout, QuantumPro EM, and Quantum Circuit Simulation.
• Keysight Technologies, Inc. (NYSE: KEYS) announced that they support the development of the new NVIDIA NVQLink open architecture for the low-latency of quantum processors and AI supercomputing. This initiative marks a significant milestone for Keysight aimed at uniting high-performance control systems with AI-driven infrastructure to accelerate quantum research and hybrid compute development.

**6G and Advanced Wireless Technologies:**
• According to Keysight, one of the most significant developments is the evolution of wireless networks toward 6G, with the FR3 spectrum emerging as a critical bridge between traditional sub-6 GHz bands and millimeter wave. In contrast to 5G, where AI was largely centralized on the network side, 6G will embed intelligence across both network infrastructure and user devices.
• Another defining capability of future networks will be integrated sensing and communication. Keysight predicts that sensing will transition from experimental research into a monetizable network feature, enabling applications such as elder care monitoring, smart manufacturing coordination, infrastructure observation, and defense use cases.

**AI Infrastructure Solutions:**
• Keysight Introduces Electronic Design Automation Software Suite Amplifying Designer Productivity with AI

## 5. Growth Strategy

**Innovation-Driven Strategy:**
Innovation drives Keysight Technologies growth strategy through a software‑centric pivot, recurring revenue expansion, and targeted domain investments that align R&D spend with market demand for electronic test equipment and software‑defined test platforms. Technical execution concentrates on measurement‑to‑simulation workflows, AI automation, and standards‑driven product roadmaps to capture semiconductor test and wireless market opportunities.

**R&D Investment:**
• R&D intensity (~16–17% of revenue; ~$900M in FY2023) funds platform integration and domain R&D.
• The company allocated $250 million to R&D, a 10.6% increase from $226 million in the same period of 2024

**Target Market Expansion:**
Keysight expands from instruments into integrated solution stacks across 5G‑Advanced/6G (sub‑THz, 100–300 GHz), AI datacenter/high‑speed digital (800G–1.6T optical), EV/power electronics, and aerospace/defense EW and radar test.

## 6. Current and Potential Major Clients

**Customer Base:**
• Keysight owns 2,000+ patents and our ~15,000 employees work with nearly 32,000 customers worldwide
• A diversified global business serving multiple industries and over 40,000 customers annually with no customer accounting for more than 10% of FY24 revenue
• Keysight customers span the communications, industrial automation, aerospace and defense, automotive, energy, semiconductor, and general electronics markets.

**Notable Partnerships:**
• Samsung has been at the forefront of 5G modem technology and with Keysight's emulators and test platforms, we are able to quickly develop and evaluate 5G NTN connections using our Exynos Modem development platform." · Huiwon Je Vice President, Modem Development Team Samsung Electronics · "We are delighted to have Keysight join the Intel Foundry Services EDA Alliance, enabling a range of RF simulation, design, and test capabilities from which IFS customers will benefit."

## 7. Financial Data & Performance

**Revenue and Earnings (Recent):**
• In 2025, Keysight Technologies's revenue was $5.38 billion, an increase of 7.95% compared to the previous year's $4.98 billion. Earnings were $850.00 million, an increase of 38.44%.
• Looking ahead, Keysight provided optimistic guidance for Q1 2026, with expected revenue between $1.53 billion and $1.55 billion, and EPS ranging from $1.95 to $2.01.

**Q4 2025 Performance:**
• Orders grew 14%, revenue increased 10%, and EPS rose 16%.
• Keysight Technologies exceeded Q4 2025 forecasts with EPS of $1.91 vs $1.82 expected and revenue of $1.42B vs $1.39B projected, driving a 2.87% after-hours stock increase to $177.67. Revenue grew 10% year-over-year with orders up 14%, fueled by strong demand in AI infrastructure and semiconductor testing, while maintaining 65% gross margin and 26% operating margin.

**Cash and Financial Health:**
• We ended the quarter with $1.9 billion in cash and cash equivalents, generating cash flow from operations of $225 million and free cash flow of $188 million.

## 8. Headwinds & Tailwinds

**Tailwinds:**
• AI Infrastructure Demand: Our portfolio is enabling major innovation waves shaping our markets: AI and accelerated compute, non-terrestrial networks, 6G, next-gen semiconductors, and defense modernization.
• Market Leadership: Strong AI-driven demand, leadership in next-generation wireless technologies, and expansion into software are fueling sustainable growth and reducing reliance on traditional hardware. Robust government and defense spending, along with advanced R&D and acquisitions, position Keysight for multi-year stability and strengthen its competitive advantages.

**Headwinds:**
• Tariffs and Cost Pressures: Tariffs and an unfavorable mix continue to depress gross margins (down 1 percentage point for nine months).
• Integration Challenges: The issuance of $750 million in new senior notes, raising long-term debt to $2.5 billion, signals Keysight's commitment to growth through acquisitions, particularly with the pending Spirent and Synopsys OSG deals. This strategy aims to expand market reach and technology offerings but simultaneously increases financial leverage and integration risk.

## 9. Market Shares

As of Q1 2025, Keysight Technologies Inc. commanded a market share of 29.87% within its competitive set, based on total revenue for the twelve months ending Q1 2025.

**Test & Measurement Market:**
The five leading vendors-Keysight Technologies, Rohde & Schwarz, Emerson's NI, Fortive (comprising Tektronix and Fluke), and Anritsu-controlled roughly two-thirds of 2024 revenue.

The Test And Measurement Market worth USD 19.84 billion in 2026 is growing at a CAGR of 4.1% to reach USD 24.26 billion by 2031.

## 10. Comparison to Competitors

**Key Competitors:**
• Viavi Solutions, Yokogawa Electric, National Instruments, Gantner Instruments, and Dewetron are some of the 20 competitors of Keysight Technologies.
• Fortive Corporation, Keysight Technologies, Inc., Rohde & Schwarz GmbH & Co. ... Keysight Technologies, Inc. Rohde & Schwarz GmbH & Co. KG

**Competitive Advantages:**
• We think Keysight's large research and development budget has created a competitively advantaged portfolio for communications testing that we don't expect other firms would be able to easily replicate.
• Keysight's technology leadership supports our strategy to deliver first-to-market solutions for our customers, which in turn enables them to be first to market with their products and gain a competitive advantage.

## 11. Partnerships, Mergers and Acquisitions

**Recent Major Acquisitions:**

**Spirent Communications (2025):**
• Keysight Technologies, Inc. (NYSE: KEYS), today announced it has completed its acquisition of Spirent Communications plc (LSE: SPT). The aggregate transaction consideration totaled approximately £1.16 billion (around US $1.46 billion) on a fully diluted basis.
• The sale closed October 15, 2025, including the regulatory required spin off of three divisions.

**Historical Acquisitions:**
• In 2017, Keysight acquired data technology company Ixia for about $US1.6 billion in cash. The company acquired British software testing company Eggplant Software from The Carlyle Group for $330 million in 2020.
• In 2023, the company acquired France-based ESI Group for approximately $1 billion.

## 12. Recent Developments

**Q4 2025 Strong Performance:**
• Keysight Technologies delivered strong Q4 results, with orders up 14% and revenue growth across all regions, signaling renewed business momentum.
• In a move signaling confidence in its financial health and a commitment to returning value to shareholders, Keysight's Board of Directors authorized a new share repurchase program for up to $1.5 billion of its common stock.

**Technology Innovations (Late 2025/Early 2026):**
• Keysight Technologies announced the launch of its Quantum System Analysis EDA solution, expanded its high-power test equipment portfolio, and revealed a collaboration with MediaTek to advance pre-6G integrated sensing and communication technologies. These developments showcase Keysight's rapid innovation in quantum computing, test automation, and next-generation wireless standards, reinforcing its position at the forefront of technical measurement solutions in high-growth sectors.

**Strategic Partnerships:**
• Keysight has signed a five-year Master Research Collaboration Agreement (MRCA) with Singapore's leading quantum research institutions.

## 13. AI Investment Rating & Fair Value Assessment

**Financial Performance Assessment:**
Keysight demonstrates strong fundamentals with revenue of $5.38 billion in 2025, representing an 7.95% increase and maintaining 65% gross margin and 26% operating margin. The company's $1.9 billion in cash and cash equivalents provides strong financial flexibility.

**Growth Catalysts:**
• Market leadership position with 29.87% market share in competitive set
• Strong exposure to high-growth sectors: AI infrastructure, 6G development, quantum computing
• Successful completion of strategic acquisitions expanding capabilities
• targeting above 20% recurring mix in the medium term to stabilize revenue

**Risk Factors:**
• Rising tariff costs pressuring margins
• Integration risks from $2.5B in acquisition debt
• Market cyclicality in semiconductor and communications sectors

**Valuation Analysis:**
Current trading price of ~$207 with analyst price targets averaging $219.77 and ranging up to $240. Keysight Technologies' forecasts yield a $187.60 fair value, a 4% upside to its current price.

**Buy Rating: 7.2/10**

The rating reflects Keysight's strong market position, exposure to high-growth technology trends (AI, 6G, quantum), and solid financial performance. However, near-term margin pressure from tariffs, integration risks from recent acquisitions, and cyclical market exposure moderate the upside potential.

**Estimated Fair Value: $225**

Based on the company's leadership in critical technology enablement sectors, strong recurring revenue growth trajectory, successful integration of strategic acquisitions, and exposure to multi-year technology upgrade cycles in AI infrastructure and next-generation wireless technologies. The fair value assumes successful mitigation of tariff impacts and realization of acquisition synergies.
tldr_summary:
Keysight Technologies is a global electronic design and test solutions provider, specializing in advanced measurement equipment and software for technology innovation across communications, semiconductor, and emerging technology sectors.

The company demonstrates strong market leadership in test and measurement, with a 29.87% market share and strategic focus on high-growth domains like AI infrastructure, 6G wireless technologies, and quantum computing. Key differentiators include substantial R&D investments (~16-17% of revenue), recent strategic acquisitions like Spirent Communications, and diversified customer base across 40,000 global enterprises. Critical recent developments include quantum computing initiatives, advanced wireless technology research, and expansion into AI-driven electronic design automation solutions.

With a robust financial performance, diverse technology portfolio, and analysts' average price target of $219.77, Keysight receives a buy rating of 7.2/10, reflecting strong growth potential balanced against integration and market cyclicality risks.
